trans-unit.source: Definition of Human Rights

seg-source.mrk: Definition of Human Rights

target.mrk: Definition of Human Rights

trans-unit.source: Human rights can be defined as the rights and freedoms that all humans are entitled to. These rights are certain entitlements that every one has access to because they are human beings. These entitlements exist in form of norms and moral standards of a society or rights that are supported by nations in the world.

seg-source.mrk: Human rights can be defined as the rights and freedoms that all humans are entitled to.
These rights are certain entitlements that every one has access to because they are human beings.
These entitlements exist in form of norms and moral standards of a society or rights that are supported by nations in the world.

target.mrk: Human rights can be defined as the rights and freedoms that all humans are entitled to.
These rights are certain entitlements that every one has access to because they are human beings.
These entitlements exist in form of norms and moral standards of a society or rights that are supported by nations in the world.

trans-unit.source: Meaning and historical background of UDHR

seg-source.mrk: Meaning and historical background of UDHR

target.mrk: Meaning and historical background of UDHR

trans-unit.source: UDHR means the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. The declaration took place on 10 December 1948 in Paris, France.

seg-source.mrk: UDHR means the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
The declaration took place on 10 December 1948 in Paris, France.

target.mrk: UDHR means the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
The declaration took place on 10 December 1948 in Paris, France.

trans-unit.source: The Declaration was translated into at least 375 languages and dialects. The declaration consists of 30 articles which are known as UDHR. The document has great significance in the history of human rights. It consists of international treaties, regional human rights instrument and national constitutions and laws. The adoption of the UDHR is a significant international ceremony marked each year on 10 December which has been set aside as “International Human Rights Day”.

seg-source.mrk: The Declaration was translated into at least 375 languages and dialects.
The declaration consists of 30 articles which are known as UDHR.
The document has great significance in the history of human rights.
It consists of international treaties, regional human rights instrument and national constitutions and laws.
The adoption of the UDHR is a significant international ceremony marked each year on 10 December which has been set aside as “International Human Rights Day”.

target.mrk: The Declaration was translated into at least 375 languages and dialects.
The declaration consists of 30 articles which are known as UDHR.
The document has great significance in the history of human rights.
It consists of international treaties, regional human rights instrument and national constitutions and laws.
The adoption of the UDHR is a significant international ceremony marked each year on 10 December which has been set aside as “International Human Rights Day”.

trans-unit.source: The Seven Core Freedoms

seg-source.mrk: The Seven Core Freedoms

target.mrk: The Seven Core Freedoms

trans-unit.source: The Seven Core Freedoms are the most fundamental articles of UDHR. They are known as Seven Core Freedoms because of their vital importance for humans. These Seven Core Freedoms are as follows:

seg-source.mrk: The Seven Core Freedoms are the most fundamental articles of UDHR.
They are known as Seven Core Freedoms because of their vital importance for humans.
These Seven Core Freedoms are as follows:

target.mrk: The Seven Core Freedoms are the most fundamental articles of UDHR.
They are known as Seven Core Freedoms because of their vital importance for humans.
These Seven Core Freedoms are as follows:

trans-unit.source: 1. Freedom from want

seg-source.mrk: Freedom from want

target.mrk: Freedom from want

trans-unit.source: 2. Freedom from fear

seg-source.mrk: Freedom from fear

target.mrk: Freedom from fear

trans-unit.source: 3. Freedom of speech and expression

seg-source.mrk: Freedom of speech and expression

target.mrk: Freedom of speech and expression

trans-unit.source: 4. Freedom of worship

seg-source.mrk: Freedom of worship

target.mrk: Freedom of worship

trans-unit.source: 5. Freedom of participation in the cultural life of a community

seg-source.mrk: Freedom of participation in the cultural life of a community

target.mrk: Freedom of participation in the cultural life of a community

trans-unit.source: 6. Freedom of peaceful assembly and association

seg-source.mrk: Freedom of peaceful assembly and association

target.mrk: Freedom of peaceful assembly and association

trans-unit.source: 7. Freedom of choice of employment

seg-source.mrk: Freedom of choice of employment

target.mrk: Freedom of choice of employment

trans-unit.source: 1. Freedom from want: There are some basic necessities of life which include food, shelter and clothing. Nobody should be deprived of these essentials of life. It is the right of every man and woman to have access to these basic needs.

seg-source.mrk: Freedom from want: There are some basic necessities of life which include food, shelter and clothing.
Nobody should be deprived of these essentials of life.
It is the right of every man and woman to have access to these basic needs.

target.mrk: Freedom from want: There are some basic necessities of life which include food, shelter and clothing.
Nobody should be deprived of these essentials of life.
It is the right of every man and woman to have access to these basic needs.

trans-unit.source: 2. Freedom from fear: All human beings should be allowed to have a sense of security. They should feel protected and safe at all times. When the source of fear is a threat from one person to another or a group of person, it then becomes an offence.

seg-source.mrk: Freedom from fear: All human beings should be allowed to have a sense of security.
They should feel protected and safe at all times.
When the source of fear is a threat from one person to another or a group of person, it then becomes an offence.

target.mrk: Freedom from fear: All human beings should be allowed to have a sense of security.
They should feel protected and safe at all times.
When the source of fear is a threat from one person to another or a group of person, it then becomes an offence.

trans-unit.source: 3. Freedom of speech and expression: This is when individuals and the Press can speak openly, without the fear of being molested or arrested as far as they do not commit libel or slander.

seg-source.mrk: Freedom of speech and expression: This is when individuals and the Press can speak openly, without the fear of being molested or arrested as far as they do not commit libel or slander.

target.mrk: Freedom of speech and expression: This is when individuals and the Press can speak openly, without the fear of being molested or arrested as far as they do not commit libel or slander.

trans-unit.source: 4. Freedom of worship: Human beings have the right practice any kind of religion, provided it does not infringe on the liberty of others. Also, no one (especially minors) should be forced to participate in a particular kind of religion other than his/her parent’s religion.

seg-source.mrk: Freedom of worship: Human beings have the right practice any kind of religion, provided it does not infringe on the liberty of others.
Also, no one (especially minors) should be forced to participate in a particular kind of religion other than his/her parent’s religion.

target.mrk: Freedom of worship: Human beings have the right practice any kind of religion, provided it does not infringe on the liberty of others.
Also, no one (especially minors) should be forced to participate in a particular kind of religion other than his/her parent’s religion.

trans-unit.source: 5. Freedom of participation in the cultural life of a community: People have the right to participate in the cultural activities of their communities without discrimination. This includes the fact that even when one visits another community legally; they have the right as human beings to participate in the activities of the community.

seg-source.mrk: Freedom of participation in the cultural life of a community: People have the right to participate in the cultural activities of their communities without discrimination.
This includes the fact that even when one visits another community legally; they have the right as human beings to participate in the activities of the community.

target.mrk: Freedom of participation in the cultural life of a community: People have the right to participate in the cultural activities of their communities without discrimination.
This includes the fact that even when one visits another community legally; they have the right as human beings to participate in the activities of the community.

trans-unit.source: 6. Freedom of peaceful assembly and association: As human beings, we have the right to peaceful assembly and association. People should be free to belong to any social group of their choice as far as their activities do not infringe on others fundamental human rights nor violate the laws of the land.

seg-source.mrk: Freedom of peaceful assembly and association: As human beings, we have the right to peaceful assembly and association.
People should be free to belong to any social group of their choice as far as their activities do not infringe on others fundamental human rights nor violate the laws of the land.

target.mrk: Freedom of peaceful assembly and association: As human beings, we have the right to peaceful assembly and association.
People should be free to belong to any social group of their choice as far as their activities do not infringe on others fundamental human rights nor violate the laws of the land.

trans-unit.source: 7. Freedom of choice of employment: Human beings have the right to do any job of their choice, as far as it is legal. People should not be forced to do jobs they do not want or that would infringe on their ethics.

seg-source.mrk: Freedom of choice of employment: Human beings have the right to do any job of their choice, as far as it is legal.
People should not be forced to do jobs they do not want or that would infringe on their ethics.

target.mrk: Freedom of choice of employment: Human beings have the right to do any job of their choice, as far as it is legal.
People should not be forced to do jobs they do not want or that would infringe on their ethics.

trans-unit.source: The Roles of Individuals in UDHR

seg-source.mrk: The Roles of Individuals in UDHR

target.mrk: The Roles of Individuals in UDHR

trans-unit.source: For UDHR to survive, there is the need for individuals to play certain roles. Some of these roles include the following:

seg-source.mrk: For UDHR to survive, there is the need for individuals to play certain roles.
Some of these roles include the following:

target.mrk: For UDHR to survive, there is the need for individuals to play certain roles.
Some of these roles include the following:

trans-unit.source: 1. Make Universal Human Right a reality

seg-source.mrk: Make Universal Human Right a reality

target.mrk: Make Universal Human Right a reality

trans-unit.source: 2. Do not get involved in any dehumanizing act

seg-source.mrk: Do not get involved in any dehumanizing act

target.mrk: Do not get involved in any dehumanizing act

trans-unit.source: 3. Make your community habitable for all

seg-source.mrk: Make your community habitable for all

target.mrk: Make your community habitable for all

trans-unit.source: 4. Do not discriminate against tribe, race and religion of others

seg-source.mrk: Do not discriminate against tribe, race and religion of others

target.mrk: Do not discriminate against tribe, race and religion of others

trans-unit.source: 5. Respect the human rights of others.

seg-source.mrk: Respect the human rights of others.

target.mrk: Respect the human rights of others.

trans-unit.source: 1. Make Universal Human Right a reality: Individuals all over the world should respect the rights of others always. Human beings should be treated with dignity.

seg-source.mrk: Make Universal Human Right a reality: Individuals all over the world should respect the rights of others always.
Human beings should be treated with dignity.

target.mrk: Make Universal Human Right a reality: Individuals all over the world should respect the rights of others always.
Human beings should be treated with dignity.

trans-unit.source: 2. Do not get involved in any dehumanizing act: There are several acts that are dehumanizing. These include human trafficking, rituals, rape, child abuse, prostitution, child labour, etc. Therefore, we should not get ourselves involved in such dehumanizing acts.

seg-source.mrk: Do not get involved in any dehumanizing act: There are several acts that are dehumanizing.
These include human trafficking, rituals, rape, child abuse, prostitution, child labour, etc.
Therefore, we should not get ourselves involved in such dehumanizing acts.

target.mrk: Do not get involved in any dehumanizing act: There are several acts that are dehumanizing.
These include human trafficking, rituals, rape, child abuse, prostitution, child labour, etc.
Therefore, we should not get ourselves involved in such dehumanizing acts.

trans-unit.source: 3. Make your community habitable for all: Communities should be made habitable for all by providing adequate security for all inhabitants. Therefore, individuals should make efforts at ensuring that their respective communities are habitable.

seg-source.mrk: Make your community habitable for all: Communities should be made habitable for all by providing adequate security for all inhabitants.
Therefore, individuals should make efforts at ensuring that their respective communities are habitable.

target.mrk: Make your community habitable for all: Communities should be made habitable for all by providing adequate security for all inhabitants.
Therefore, individuals should make efforts at ensuring that their respective communities are habitable.

trans-unit.source: 4. Do not discriminate against tribe, race or religion of others: It is the duty of an individual not to discriminate against the tribe, race or religion of others. Everyone should be treated equally and with fairness always.

seg-source.mrk: Do not discriminate against tribe, race or religion of others: It is the duty of an individual not to discriminate against the tribe, race or religion of others.
Everyone should be treated equally and with fairness always.

target.mrk: Do not discriminate against tribe, race or religion of others: It is the duty of an individual not to discriminate against the tribe, race or religion of others.
Everyone should be treated equally and with fairness always.

trans-unit.source: 5. Respect the rights of others: It is the duty of people to respect one another’s rights. Respect is reciprocal, thus, we should respect the rights of one another.

seg-source.mrk: Respect the rights of others: It is the duty of people to respect one another’s rights.
Respect is reciprocal, thus, we should respect the rights of one another.

target.mrk: Respect the rights of others: It is the duty of people to respect one another’s rights.
Respect is reciprocal, thus, we should respect the rights of one another.

seg-source.mrk: The Roles of Groups in UDHR

target.mrk: The Roles of Groups in UDHR

trans-unit.source: Apart from individual roles in promoting human rights, groups/organizations equally have roles to play in promoting human rights. The following are some arms of the United Nations Organization (UNO) that promote human rights:

seg-source.mrk: Apart from individual roles in promoting human rights, groups/organizations equally have roles to play in promoting human rights.
The following are some arms of the United Nations Organization (UNO) that promote human rights:

target.mrk: Apart from individual roles in promoting human rights, groups/organizations equally have roles to play in promoting human rights.
The following are some arms of the United Nations Organization (UNO) that promote human rights:

trans-unit.source: 1. World Health Organization (WHO)

target.mrk: World Health Organization (WHO)

trans-unit.source: 2. United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)

seg-source.mrk: United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)

target.mrk: United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)

trans-unit.source: 3. United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF)

seg-source.mrk: United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF)

target.mrk: United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF)

trans-unit.source: 4. United Nations High Commission for Refugees (UNHCR)

seg-source.mrk: United Nations High Commission for Refugees (UNHCR)

target.mrk: United Nations High Commission for Refugees (UNHCR)

trans-unit.source: The Roles of Government in UDHR

seg-source.mrk: The Roles of Government in UDHR

target.mrk: The Roles of Government in UDHR

trans-unit.source: The government of each country has roles to play in ensuring that the rights of human beings are protected. These roles include the following:

seg-source.mrk: The government of each country has roles to play in ensuring that the rights of human beings are protected.
These roles include the following:

target.mrk: The government of each country has roles to play in ensuring that the rights of human beings are protected.
These roles include the following:

trans-unit.source: 1. Poverty eradication

seg-source.mrk: Poverty eradication

target.mrk: Poverty eradication

trans-unit.source: 2. Human development

seg-source.mrk: Human development

target.mrk: Human development

trans-unit.source: 3. Human security

seg-source.mrk: Human security

target.mrk: Human security

trans-unit.source: 4. Equality of educational opportunities

seg-source.mrk: Equality of educational opportunities

target.mrk: Equality of educational opportunities

trans-unit.source: 5. Funding of groups/organizations that promote UDHR

seg-source.mrk: Funding of groups/organizations that promote UDHR

target.mrk: Funding of groups/organizations that promote UDHR

trans-unit.source: 6. Discouragement of human abuse

seg-source.mrk: Discouragement of human abuse

target.mrk: Discouragement of human abuse

trans-unit.source: 7. Promotion of peace and harmony

seg-source.mrk: Promotion of peace and harmony

target.mrk: Promotion of peace and harmony

trans-unit.source: 1. Poverty eradication: Many people around the world live in abject poverty as they cannot afford the basic necessities of life. Therefore, poverty needs to be eradicated so that people can live happily. It is the role of government, therefore, to engage in programmes that would eradicate poverty.

seg-source.mrk: Poverty eradication: Many people around the world live in abject poverty as they cannot afford the basic necessities of life.
Therefore, poverty needs to be eradicated so that people can live happily.
It is the role of government, therefore, to engage in programmes that would eradicate poverty.

target.mrk: Poverty eradication: Many people around the world live in abject poverty as they cannot afford the basic necessities of life.
Therefore, poverty needs to be eradicated so that people can live happily.
It is the role of government, therefore, to engage in programmes that would eradicate poverty.

trans-unit.source: 2. Human development: Human beings can be developed through formal or vocational education. Education equips people with different skills which enable them to develop themselves and the society as a whole.

seg-source.mrk: Human development: Human beings can be developed through formal or vocational education.
Education equips people with different skills which enable them to develop themselves and the society as a whole.

target.mrk: Human development: Human beings can be developed through formal or vocational education.
Education equips people with different skills which enable them to develop themselves and the society as a whole.

trans-unit.source: 3. Human Security: Security cannot be separated from human rights. People need security from government at all times. This is provided through various security outlets such as the Police, the Army and the Court of Law.

seg-source.mrk: Human Security: Security cannot be separated from human rights.
People need security from government at all times.
This is provided through various security outlets such as the Police, the Army and the Court of Law.

target.mrk: Human Security: Security cannot be separated from human rights.
People need security from government at all times.
This is provided through various security outlets such as the Police, the Army and the Court of Law.

trans-unit.source: 4. Equality of educational opportunities: There is inequality of educational opportunities across the world. This has created a gap among individuals and various sections of the society. It is the duty of government therefore to provide equal educational opportunities to all her citizens.

seg-source.mrk: Equality of educational opportunities: There is inequality of educational opportunities across the world.
This has created a gap among individuals and various sections of the society.
It is the duty of government therefore to provide equal educational opportunities to all her citizens.

target.mrk: Equality of educational opportunities: There is inequality of educational opportunities across the world.
This has created a gap among individuals and various sections of the society.
It is the duty of government therefore to provide equal educational opportunities to all her citizens.

trans-unit.source: 5. Funding of groups/organizations that promote UDHR: Various governments should endeavour to fund organizations or groups that engage in the promotion of the <content-1/>principles of UDHR. They could do this by funding both governmental and Non-governmental <content-2/>organizations (NGOs)

seg-source.mrk: Funding of groups/organizations that promote UDHR: Various governments should endeavour to fund organizations or groups that engage in the promotion of the <content-1/>principles of UDHR.
They could do this by funding both governmental and Non-governmental <content-2/>organizations (NGOs)

target.mrk: Funding of groups/organizations that promote UDHR: Various governments should endeavour to fund organizations or groups that engage in the promotion of the <content-1/>principles of UDHR.
They could do this by funding both governmental and Non-governmental <content-2/>organizations (NGOs)

trans-unit.source: 6. Discouragement of human abuse: Governments are expected to enact laws that would fight against human abuse in their respective countries.

seg-source.mrk: Discouragement of human abuse: Governments are expected to enact laws that would fight against human abuse in their respective countries.

target.mrk: Discouragement of human abuse: Governments are expected to enact laws that would fight against human abuse in their respective countries.

trans-unit.source: 7. Promotion of peace and harmony: Peace and harmony are necessary conditions for the promotion of human rights. Therefore, governments are expected to promote peace and harmony in their countries.

seg-source.mrk: Promotion of peace and harmony: Peace and harmony are necessary conditions for the promotion of human rights.
Therefore, governments are expected to promote peace and harmony in their countries.

target.mrk: Promotion of peace and harmony: Peace and harmony are necessary conditions for the promotion of human rights.
Therefore, governments are expected to promote peace and harmony in their countries.
